description.narrative: 1. Increase in affordable housing supply: The Project will contribute to the alleviation of the current affordable housing deficit in India and will improve the quality of life by making housing, a basic need, more affordable. 2. Employment generation: The Project is expected to create a large number of new construction, sales and marketing jobs. 3. Enhanced supply linkages: The Project will increase demand for construction and building materials in the country. 4. Demonstration effect: The Project will serve as an example to improve private sector development in this segment of the housing market, which is typically ignored by investors.

Shapoorji Pallonji And Company Limited (SPCL) is in the civil construction and real estate development business. SPCL plans to raise up to US$200 million to establish a platform that will develop 15-17 million square feet of affordable housing projects across India over the next 8 years. SPCL will contribute 30% of the capital, and investors, including IFC will contribute the rest.
